title: Documents from the Planning and Early Days of the Wyatt Detention Facility (Mentioned in 2002 Harvard Design School Paper)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A number of documents related to the planning, launch, and early operations of the Wyatt Detention Facility that are mentioned in the publicly available 20-page Harvard Design School paper on the Wyatt from 2002. That case study, authored by HSD graduate student, Arjan Bol, can be found here: https://www.dunwalke.com/resources/documents/Events/Harvard_Case_Study_940101-014.pdf.

The documents I am seeking include:

-The prospectus for the Donald W. Wyatt Detention Facility. (Mentioned in the “Sources” section of Bol's paper on page 20.)

-The final plans for the Donald W. Wyatt Detention Facility. (Mentioned in the “City Approval” section on page 9, in a sentence that reads, in part, “In July 1991, the final plans were presented to the residents and the City Council of Central Falls…”)

-The March 2, 1992 Loan and Trust Agreement between the Rhode Island Port Authority and the Central Falls Detention Facility Corporation. (Mentioned in the “Loan and Trust Agreement” section on page 11, in a sentence that reads, in part, “…on March 2, 1992, the Board approved the ‘Loan and Trust Agreement’ between the Rhode Island Port Authority and the Central Falls Detention Facility Corporation.”)

-The August 19, 1991 Intergovernmental Agreement between the U.S. Marshals Service and the Central Falls Detention Facility Corporation. (Mentioned in the “Intergovernmental Agreement” section on pages 13 and 14, in a sentence that reads, in part, “…resulting in the signing of the Intergovernmental Agreement on August 19, 1991 between the Central Falls Detention Facility Corporation and the United States of America, acting for and through the US Marshal Service.”)

-The November 1, 1991 report by consultants Arthur Andersen & Co. (Mentioned in the “The Arthur Andersen report” section on page 14, in sentences that read, “Cornell Cox hired the prestigious consulting firm, Arthur Andersen & Co., to estimate the need for detention bed space. The Andersen report, dated November 1, 1991…”)

-The August 1991 design-build contract with Brown & Root for the construction of the Wyatt Detention Facility. (Mentioned in the “Design-Build contract” section on page 15, in a sentence that reads, “In August 1991, CFDFC signed a design-build contract with a fixed price of US $21.2 million (including acquisition costs) with Brown & Root.”)

-The Wyatt Detention Facility Operator’s Agreement signed by Cornell Cox. (Mentioned in the “Operator's Agreement” section on page 16, in a sentence that reads, “Cornell Cox signed a contract with CFDFC to operate and manage the detention facility.”)

-The Detention Center Associates’ consulting agreement for the Wyatt Detention Facility. (Mentioned in the “Consulting Agreement” section on page 16, in a sentence that reads, “DCA, involved in the project from the beginning, signed a one-year consulting contract with CFDFC.”)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Philip Eil

title: Materials from the Wyatt Detention Facility’s Ten-Year Anniversary Celebration on July 18, 2003

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Materials from the Wyatt Detention Facility’s Ten-Year Anniversary Celebration on July 18, 2003
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any materials related to the Wyatt Detention Facility’s Ten-Year Anniversary Celebration luncheon held at Pawtucket Country Club on July 18, 2003. This includes:

-Photographs of the event.

-Written materials related to the event, including plans, guest lists, invitations, menus, programs, and prepared remarks.

-A video that was shown at the event, described in the facility’s 2003 annual report as “a specially prepared video program highlighting the major milestones over the past ten years [which] gave viewers an opportunity to become aware of both the economic and criminal justice benefits and contributions the Wyatt has made.”

-Any other printed or multimedia documents related to the event.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Philip Eil

title: FBI files: Brian Wilson

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI files: Brian Wilson
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request an electronic copy of all FBI files on Brian Wilson, the American musician and founder of the Beach Boys. Here is his obituary: https://www.reuters.com/world/brian-wilson-co-creator-beach-boys-dies-aged-82-2025-06-11/

I request that your agency conduct a full CRS search, as well as a cross reference search, to retrieve records related to this prominent American.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: Request to CIA for 2023 budget report for Office of Public Affairs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to CIA for 2023 budget report for Office of Public Affairs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The 2023 annual budget report for the Office of Public Affairs of the Central Intelligence Agency.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement - AF 2025-05896-F
communications.communication:
Dear Brett  Carollo, 
This is to acknowledge receipt of your 12-Jun-25, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request for "the following records:The 2023 annual budget report for the Public Affairs Agency of the U.S. Air Force." (Date Range for Record Search: From 01/01/2014 To 06/12/2025). Based on our initial review, we believe we cannot process your request within the statutory 20 workdays because our organization has a significant number of pending FOIA requests.  To ensure all requesters are properly served in the order their requests were received, we have instituted multitrack processing of requests.  Based on the information you provided, we have placed your request in the complex track. The Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) provides for the collection of fees based on the costs of processing a FOIA request and your fee category.  Based upon the information provided in your request, we have placed you in the Other category.  Regarding your request for a fee waiver, we defer regarding this, or any subsequent fee issue until the review of responsive records is complete.  At that time you will be contacted relative to fees. We have assigned number 2025-05896-F to identify your request; should you need to contact us about your request.  Please direct your questions to SAF.AA.HAF.FOIA.Workflow@us.af.mil and use this assigned number to assist us in responding more promptly. We will strive to provide an update between 90 and 120 days.  Our policy is to process requests within their respective tracks in the order in which they were received in accordance with 32 CFR, Part 286.8.  We will notify you in writing if additional processing time is required.  We do process each FOIA request as quickly as possible, however delayed responses can be expected. Very Respectfully, HAF FOIA TEAM SAF/AAII (FOIA) Office of the Secretary of the Air Force 1000 Air Force Pentagon Washington, DC 20330-1000

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Professional Mobility Research - Arizona Driver License Documentation

Requesting driver license records maintained by the Motor Vehicle Division for Justin Kashuba during Arizona residency period (approximately 1993-2002).


**Records requested:**
- Driver license applications, renewals, and photographs
- Complete driving record including citations and accidents
- Vehicle registration records for registered vehicles
- Address change history during Arizona residence


**Privacy Protection Request:**
Please redact date of birth and SSN from provided records while maintaining document integrity for research purposes which requires record content but not personal identifying information such as DOB and SSN.


**Research focuses on professional mobility patterns during career development and interstate documentation procedures. Academic study examines driver records as documentation of professional geographic mobility and civic compliance.**

**Fee waiver requested for academic research into professional mobility patterns and government documentation practices.**

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Request to Marines for Personnel Record of Adam Driver

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the U.S. Marines Corps personnel records (OMPF) for a former servicemember named ADAM DOUGLAS DRIVER (DATE OF BIRTH: 11/19/1983). Mr. Driver was born in Fontana, California. He served in the U.S. Marines Corps from 2001 to 2004 and achieved the rank of lance corporal. The requested records include performance reports, job assessments, disciplinary records, training received, discharge papers, and any other releasable records.

I originally submitted this request to the National Personnel Records Center, which ordinarily handles these requests, but they claimed that they could locate no records for Mr. Driver. They forwarded the request to the Marines, who administratively closed my request after I did not respond to a denial letter (that I never personally received until after the closure) of my waiver of fees request. This is why I am sending the request directly to this office.

The public interest in Mr. Driver, an Academy Award-nominated film actor , should favor disclosure of many of these records, particularly in relation to any disciplinary records, should those records exist.

Please be sure to review and release any segregable information, even if certain documents or portions of documents are withheld.

PLEASE NOTE: I am not a next of kin of this servicemember, and thus do not know Mr. Driver’s Social Security Number. Because of this, I am ONLY requesting records releasable under the Freedom of Information Act. Please process my request for this servicemember's OMPF and other records under the Freedom of Information Act’s relevant provisions. I am not seeking any records that would be releasable under the Privacy Act.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Public Records Request – 911 and Dispatch Activity Near AHOPE, Woods-Mullen Shelter, and Southampton Shelter

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request – 911 and Dispatch Activity Near AHOPE, Woods-Mullen Shelter, and Southampton Shelter
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law (M.G.L. c. 66, § 10), I am requesting the following records:

1. Computer-Aided Dispatch (CAD) logs and 911 call records
From January 1, 2022 to present for all calls for service involving:

-774 Albany Street (AHOPE and SPOT)
-112 Southampton Street (Southampton Shelter)
-794 Massachusetts Avenue (Woods-Mullen Shelter)
-Albany Street corridor from Massachusetts Avenue to Southampton Street
-Intersections at:
-Albany St & Massachusetts Ave
-Albany St & East Lenox St
-Albany St & Southampton St
-Please include for each call:

-Date and time
-Nature or category of the call (including but not limited to: drug use, drug dealing, overdoses, narcotics possession, suspicious activity, assault, robbery, trespassing, loitering, public disturbances)
-Final disposition (e.g., report filed, arrest made, cleared, no action)
-Any associated case or incident number

2. Incident Reports
Please include redacted incident reports for drug activity, overdoses, assaults, threats, or other safety concerns at or near these addresses.

3. Internal Communications
All internal emails, memos, and  reports created between January 1, 2022 and the present involving any of the following personnel or offices:

Officers and supervisors in Boston Police District D-4, including but not limited to the District Captain, Shift Commanders, and Community Service Officers
Staff within the BPD Legal Division or Office of the Police Commissioner

Officials from the Mayor’s Office, Boston Public Health Commission, or Coordinated Response Team

Specifically regarding:

Patterns of drug activity, overdoses, or public safety concerns in the areas surrounding AHOPE (774 Albany St), Woods-Mullen Shelter (794 Mass Ave), and Southampton Shelter (112 Southampton St)

Decisions not to arrest, cite, or remove individuals for open drug use or dealing in the above zones

Coordination or conflict between harm reduction services and law enforcement

Public records requests, community complaints, or media inquiries involving these locations

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Army support for 2023 film "The Covenant"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Army support for 2023 film "The Covenant"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the U.S. Army and the production of the 2023 movie "The Covenant," directed by Guy Ritchie. I request any and all documents pertaining to DoD support for "The Covenant." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of the Army and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The Covenant," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

An opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records of consumer complaints from 2015 to 2025 about healthcare providers, doctors, hospitals, or surgical centers containing any of the phrases “prepay,” “upfront,” “down payment,” “refund,” “reimbursed,” “prior to necessary medical care,” and “non-emergency procedure.” This includes but is not limited to complaints via the NY Attorney General’s Health Care Complaint Form. communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Faculty Handbook(s) (or similar document(s) if called something different at VMI)  for the following academic years and any other relevant faculty guidance (request to professors for diversity statements in course curriculum, faculty hiring guidance, diversity goals, training, etc.) showing how VMI implemented DEI/DOI/Inclusive Excellence to achieve its stated BOV approved Goals and Objectives as well as implement the Barnes & Thorneburg Investigation recommendations.

I understand that the term "DEI" is currently a subject of controversy. Still, it is included because VMI's program was initially called DEI until its name was changed to DOI, and what appears to be the current term "inclusive Excellence." If the program is currently operating under a different name, please help me clarify this and include it in my request.

2019 - 2020
2020 - 2021
2021 - 2022

2023 - 2024
2024 - Present

title: Emails from Nancy Hawes to SLDC that predate her appointment to the board and COI paperwork

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Emails from Nancy Hawes to SLDC that predate her appointment to the board and COI paperwork
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

We are asking for copies of emails sent by to SLDC by Nancy Hawes, Mayor Spencer's Chief of Staff and SLDC's current chair, which were sent in the ten years prior to her coming to work for the city. During this time, Ms. Hawes worked for Polsinelli PC, Amstrong Teasdale and The Hawes Law Firm. We are seeking any correspondence that she may have had with SLDC during this time period, where she was active in working on local real estate matters. This includes, but is not limited to, any emails she had with SLDC relating to her work related to federal Opportunity Zones.

We are also asking a copy of any conflict of interest paperwork that Ms. Hawes would have filed as part of joining SLDC's board.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Glenn Burleigh

title: Public Records Request - Volusia County

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Volusia County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:
https://atlantablackstar.com/2024/11/21/florida-couple-attacked-school-cop-police-say/

Exact date of incident: Nov 19, 2024
Names of parties involved: Jorge Rivera and his wife, Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino
Location: Deltona Middle School, about 30 miles northeast of Orlando in Volusia County

I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.

I understand that there may be associated costs for providing this footage, and I am more than willing to cover any fees incurred. Please inform me about the necessary procedures and the costs involved.

Thank you in advance for your assistance. I trust that this footage will be invaluable for my educational efforts, and I greatly appreciate your cooperation.


Best regards,
George Smith

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

George Smith

communications.communication:
Your request was received and sent for processing.

Please understand that your response or records WILL NOT come from the PIA email, but will come from the department who processed your request and their email will end with:  tdcj.texas.gov

The Texas Department of Criminal Justice (TDCJ) is allowed 10 business days (Monday through Friday, excluding holidays) to process requests.

Texas Department of Criminal Justice - PIA
Open Records Coordinator
Office of General Counsel

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into spy novelist Frederick McCarthy Forsyth (25 August 1938 – 9 June 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find an obituary from the BBC at the following link: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/cley59le6d8o

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, Reason Magazine, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: All records relating to Ana L. Toledo

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sirs:

I. Requester

This letter constitutes a request under the Privacy Act/ Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, on behalf of the undersigned, Ana L. Toledo, born February 16, 1967. I specifically request that you include in your search all files in the “Restricted Files” and “Prohibited Access” files within the Sentinel system. I specifically request that you abstain from the practice implemented by former director Michael Seidel of obstructing the production of records as former FOIA office director, falsely classifying as exempted documents that are not as such. 

There is no FOIA exemption for records that prove government corruption and crimes..

The records requested may be associated to of the following variations of her name or identifying information:

	A) Ana Luisa Toledo
	B) Ana Toledo
	C) Ana Toledo-Davila
	D) ALT22@columbia.edu
	E) ALT22@caa.columbia.edu
	F) Ana Luisa Toledo Davila
	G) Analuda
	H) xxx-99-4857
	I) Assigned Terrorist Screening Center identifying number (?)

To ensure you respond thoroughly, and aside from the current address at the top of this letter, the physical addresses associated to the requester are the following:

	202 Sol Street, San Juan PR 00901
	674 Flores de Montehiedra, San Juan 00926
	B22 Prado Alto Dev., Guaynabo, PR 00966
	208 Wesser St., Rio Piedras Heights, San Juan 00926
	920 ½ Knox St, Houston, TX 77007
           5324 Boreas Drive, Alvin, Texas

II. Definitions

The term “record” is to be liberally construed to include: any 1) sound or voice recording, 2) photographs or images (.png, .jpg. .jpec, .tiff or any other photograph formats), 3) video, 4) text message, 5) mobile/web app messages (from applications such as Messenger, Whatsapp, Signal, Telegram, etc.) 6) email, 7) web page and blog captures and archives, 8) paper, computer or digital file, 9) spreadsheet, 10) paper, 11) microfilm, 12) digital archive, 13) x-Rays or imaging, 14) recorded conversations or audio messages; 15) document or any other format where the information sought may be stored. The term “record” includes both the principal record responsive to the request as well as any studies, exhibits, supporting documentation or supplement thereof.

III. Records Requested

I request the production of a copy of the following records relating to Ana L. Toledo, including all the varieties of her identifying information set forth in section I above:

1. All correspondence, including criminal complaints, and prior Freedom of Information Act requests by Ana L. Toledo to the FBI.

2. All responses from the FBI to all correspondence, criminal complaints, and Freedom of Information Act requests by Ana L. Toledo.

3. Al FISA applications and warrants, renewals obtained and/or executed against Ana L. Toledo from January 1st 1996 until July 1st 2024, and every record generated as a result of each one including, but not limited to the inventory of surveillance carried out and summary of each. Include the affidavit and supporting documentation submitted in support of each Section 702 FISA application and the testimony of the person(s) that submitted weach one to the FISA Court.

4. All photographs, videos, images, or any other media depicting the image of Ana L. Toledo, or her body, or any part thereof from July 1st 1996 to the present, whether authorized by her or not.

5. All voice or sound recordings including the actual or reproduced voice of Ana L. Toledo that were made with or without her knowledge or consent.

6. All “Sneak and Peak” warrants issued, requested and/or executed against Ana L. Toledo’s property or within her property. Include all records generated as a result of each one including, but not limited to: inventory of items seized, date, place. and current custodian thereof for each one.

7. All FD-930 forms filled out and submitted to nominate Ana L. Toledo to the Terrorist Screening Database and for any change of status within it.

8. Complete expense records and ledgers reflecting expenses, payments, fees, purchases, professional services paid or any other disbursement carried out in any matter relating to Ana L. Toledo.

9. Inventory and chain of custody records of all property, records and documents seized, stolen, or removed from Ana L. Toledo’s property or vehicles with or without an Article III Court warrant.

10. All geofencing warrants and renewals obtained for Ana L. Toledo or any of her known aliases, and all records generated as a result of each one up to and including July 31, 2024.

12. All communications relating to the processing of this FOIA request with anyone within or outside of the FBI.

13. Records, correspondence, or communications to and from any person (including confidential human sources) relating to Ana L. Toledo or any of her known aliases with anyone.

14. Inventory of property seized from, occupied, removed from, or otherwise taken away from Ana L. Toledo or from any of her residences or vehicles at the behest of the agency or its contractors.

15. Records obtained from any of Ana Toledo’s computers, email or social media accounts, web or smart phone applications, or phone.

16. Records of payments, bartering, financial contributions, checks, money orders, bank transfers, gifts, donations or any other kind of economic transaction made by any person, corporation, research institution, or organization including the United States Government in compensation or payment of any surveillance, physical harm, stalking and harassment services, medical procedures, veterinary actions against her pets, public relations campaigns, implanted medical devices, planted honey pots, of and/or data harvesting relating to Ana L. Toledo. 

17. All physical or electronic correspondence, footage, photographs, reports, communications, documents with any member of the state, territorial, or federal judiciary, or public or private law enforcement or security company regarding Ana L. Toledo.

18. All physical, electronic or documented conversations, documents, instructions, or any kind of communication with officials from state or federal judiciary, United States Probation Office, United States Marshals Office, IRS, or any other federal agency relating to Ana L. Toledo, her son Luis E. Pol, her property, and profession.

19. All “assessments” made about or relating to Ana L. Toledo.

20. All records regarding repairs, vandalism, sabotage and payments made in connection to Ana L. Toledo’s vehicles.

21. Any other document in your possession or that of a third party that you know of that relates to Ana L. Toledo or her property.

22. All reports,, emails, text messages, recordings, videos, images or any other kind of record regarding the monitoring of Ana L. Toledo's Former Twitter/Now X accounts under the handles @anatoledodavila and @realhitomi, including monitoring logs, correspondence, emails and communications to and from Twitter/X.

As you know, FOIA requires agencies to release information unless it is specifically exempt from disclosure, and also requires agencies to release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of documents, i.e., to redact exempt portions of documents and release the rest. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(8).

For any document you know exists but do not have, please provide name of agency and contact information to request it from.

III. Expedited Processing Request

The undersigned publishes a newsletter in anatoledo.substack.com and X articles under the handle @anatoledodavila. She currently has over 7,000 subscribers in both platforms and over 40,000 views per month. Pursuant to 47 CFR 0.466, she qualifies as a member of the news media that provides information of public interest to her subscribers. Thus the information sought is not deemed for commercial use. Id. Her status as a member of the media warrants the expedited processing of this request on the grounds that there is a compelling need for these records because the information requested is urgently needed in the endeavors of disseminating information in order to inform the public about actual or alleged Federal Government activity. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2); 28 C.F.R. § n16.5 (d)(1)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).

The records and documents requested relate to a “breaking news story of general public interest”. Furthermore, they present a “matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government’s integrity which affect public confidence”. Expedited processing is warranted when “the information is relevant to a subject of public urgency concerning an actual or alleged Federal government activity.” Id.

In light of the above, the undersigned requests that your agency adheres to the legal mandate contained in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i); see 28 C.F.R. § 16.6(b), (c) and consequently produce within 20 days of receipt of this request the information sought.

IV. Request for Fee Waiver

The undersigned hereby requests a fee waiver of search, review, and duplication fees on the grounds that disclosure of the requested records is “in the public interest because it is likely to significantly contribute to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.” See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.17(a); 28 C.F.R. § 16.11(k); 32 C.F.R. § 286.28(d); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.13(b)(2). Furthermore, a waiver of search and review fees is warranted inasmuch as the undersigned will report the results of this endeavor as a “representative of the news media” and that the records are not sought for commercial use. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii))(7); 32 C.F.R. §§ 1900.02(h)(3), 1900.13(i)(2).

For any document you fail to produce, I request that you provide a Vaughn Index and declaration setting forth reasonably detailed explanations for each withheld document as to why it falls within any statutory exemption. See Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F. 2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973). 

The Vaughn statement must specify details about each document's sender, recipients, date and time, and subject.

If you need to discuss this request, the undersigned can be reached at 832-247-3046. Thank you for your consideration of my request.

Sincerely,


Ana L. Toledo, Esq.	
analuda@proton.me
T. 832-24-3047
PO Box 15990
Houston, TX 77220

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ana Toledo

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Clinton Library: WHORM files related to Zurab Tsereteli and "The Birth of a New World" Columbus statue
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

White House Office of Records Management (WHORM) files related to the sculptor Zurab Tsereteli (Georgian: ზურაბ წერეთელი) and a sculpture of his of Christopher Columbus titled "The Birth of a New World."

For background: in 1997 the Moscow mayor's office offered a statue of Tsereteli's as a gift to the city of New York. Donald Trump lobbied to have the city allow him to place it at one of his developments. Mayor Giuliani lobbied against the statue, and for the next 18 years it was offered to other cities. 

Please search WHORM files for records related to Zurab Tsereteli and the late 1990s offer from the Russians for the statue. Keywords: Zurab Tsereteli, ზურაბ წერეთელი

For additional information: https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2016/06/trump-files-donald-almost-built-gigantic-christopher-columbus-statue/

title: Internal Deliberations on Communication Delay (Feb 3–11, 2025)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.	Any internal communications (including emails, text messages, meeting notes, or memos) sent or received by any SPUSD board member, administrator, or district staff between February 3, 2025, and February 18, 2025, that reference:
	•	Deliberations over how to publicly acknowledge or respond to any incident(s) that occurred during the week of February 3–7;
	•	Efforts to delay, manage, or coordinate messaging to parents or the public;
	•	Preparation for the February 11, 2025 board meeting, including decisions about what would or would not be addressed publicly.
2.	Any records—internal or external—reflecting anticipated or actual community records requests related to that same time period.

This request is prompted by Board Member Karissa Adams’s public statement during the February 11, 2025 board meeting. While participating remotely by phone, Ms. Adams stated:

“Let me just start by saying a real big thank you to our staff and our administration… last week we had a little bit more excitement in one week than we would like to have at the school… In this world of communication right now we need to remember that information will be dispelled as it’s necessary and available, and that doesn’t always mean, you know, right this second.”

This statement appears to acknowledge a deliberate delay in communication with families regarding a specific incident or emergency. Notably, no other board member acknowledged the comment, and no one else referred to the incident at any point during the meeting. The session continued without clarification, follow-up, or public discussion—despite the implications of the remark.

For reference, I am including a brief excerpt from the publicly available recording of the meeting:
https://archive.org/download/spusd_02-11-2025/spusd_02-11-2025.mp4

The clip has been lightly zoomed to highlight board member reactions at the moment the comment was made. The fact that a board member raised a potentially serious issue—publicly, on record—and was met with complete silence, including from colleagues physically present in the room, is relevant context for this request.

This statement—and the collective non-response that followed—raises serious questions about what was known internally, when key decisions were made, and how communication with the public was managed at both the administrative and board level.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Rochford
